title: A Family's Home Ruined by Building Work
summary: Kate and her son have been homeless for four Christmases because building work on their apartment building made their home unsafe. Workers were adding more flats on the roof, but they did a bad job. The ceiling fell down, and pigeons came in, leaving bird droppings everywhere. Kate and other families in the building are very upset. They tried to get help from courts, but it didn't work well. The building owner didn't answer their questions, and Kate lost a chance to sell her home. Now, the work is stopped, but the building is still messy and dangerous. This story shows how some people can lose their homes because of problems with building rules.

background_read: In some places, people own apartments by leasing them for a set time, while a freeholder owns the whole building. This can cause problems if the freeholder does building work that damages homes. Kate's story shows how families can become homeless when construction goes wrong and they can't get help quickly.
Article_Structure: WHO: Kate and her son, plus other families in the building
WHAT: Building work ruined their home, making it unsafe and causing homelessness
WHERE: In an apartment building in Ashford, Surrey
WHY: Because the freeholder did bad construction work and didn't answer questions

perspectives.description: Kate and others feel devastated and helpless because their homes are ruined and they can't get help.
